noun.description: A large, bowl-shaped cavity in the ground or on the surface of a planet or the moon, typically one caused by an explosion or the impact of a meteorite or other celestial body.
A large bowl used in ancient Greece for mixing wine.

verb.description: Form a crater in (the ground or a planet)
examples: he has the offensive power to crater the enemy's runways

proper noun.description: A small and faint southern constellation (the Cup), between Hydra and Leo, said to represent the goblet of Apollo.
